item.title: Four Black Features
item.dc:creator: admin
item.content:encoded:
[vc_row][vc_column width="1/4"][vc_icon type="material" icon_material="vc-material vc-material-all_inclusive" color="white" background_style="rounded" background_color="black" size="lg"][vc_custom_heading text="Online Support" font_container="tag:h3|text_align:left" use_theme_fonts="yes"][vc_column_text]

A system is said to be feature-rich when it has many options and functional capabilities available to the user.

[/vc_column_text][vc_btn title="Learn More" style="flat" shape="round" color="black"][/vc_column][vc_column width="1/4"][vc_icon type="material" icon_material="vc-material vc-material-beach_access" color="white" background_style="rounded" background_color="black" size="lg"][vc_custom_heading text="Security" font_container="tag:h3|text_align:left" use_theme_fonts="yes"][vc_column_text]

Progressive disclosure is a technique applied to reduce the potential confusion caused by displaying a wealth of features at once.

[/vc_column_text][vc_btn title="Learn More" style="flat" shape="round" color="black"][/vc_column][vc_column width="1/4"][vc_icon type="material" icon_material="vc-material vc-material-redeem" color="white" background_style="rounded" background_color="black" size="lg"][vc_custom_heading text="Discounts" font_container="tag:h3|text_align:left" use_theme_fonts="yes"][vc_column_text]

This term is also used in a pejorative fashion where it expresses the view that features are added at the expense of something that's usually considered a basic function.

[/vc_column_text][vc_btn title="Learn More" style="flat" shape="round" color="black"][/vc_column][vc_column width="1/4"][vc_icon type="material" icon_material="vc-material vc-material-face" color="white" background_style="rounded" background_color="black" size="lg"][vc_custom_heading text="Professional Team" font_container="tag:h3|text_align:left" use_theme_fonts="yes"][vc_column_text]

The main difference between software analysis and design is that the output of a software analysis consists of smaller problems to solve.

[/vc_column_text][vc_btn title="Learn More" style="flat" shape="round" color="black"][/vc_column][/vc_row][vc_row][vc_column][/vc_column][/vc_row]
